title: 3 Easy Ways to Reset an Android Phone to Factory Settings

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . This is the gear icon. A factory reset will erase all your data from your phone. It's recommended to back up your device before proceeding. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Backup and reset.
steps.content: Tap Backup and reset . On newer versions of Android, you may need to tap Additional settings first. On Samsung Galaxy devices, tap General Management , and then Reset . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Erase all data (factory reset).
steps.content: Tap Erase all data (factory reset) . A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Erase data.
steps.content: Tap Erase data . Again, this will reset all your data on your device. This includes apps, photos, contacts, and SD card files .

steps.title: Tap Erase data again.
steps.content: Tap Erase data again. This will confirm your decision. Your phone will begin to reset. This process can take up to 10 minutes, depending on the amount of data in your device.

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . This is the gear icon. Use this method if you have an Android older than version 5.0. If needed, you can check your Android version .

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Backup & reset.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Backup & reset . It's in either the Personal or Privacy section of the menu, depending on device and Android version. If you are on a Samsung Galaxy device, instead tap General Management and then tap Reset . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Factory data reset.
steps.content: Tap Factory data reset . It's at the bottom of the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Reset Phone.
steps.content: Tap Reset Phone . Once the reset process is complete, your phone will be formatted as it was when it left the factory. If you are on a Samsung Galaxy device, instead tap Reset .

steps.title: Enter your screen lock passcode.
steps.content: Enter your screen lock passcode. If your phone has a screen lock enabled, you will be asked to enter your phone's pattern, PIN, or passcode.

steps.title: Tap Erase everything to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Erase everything to confirm. This will immediately erase all of the phone's data and reboots to the factory default settings and configuration. The process can take several minutes. If you are on a Samsung Galaxy device, instead tap Delete All .

steps.title: Power off
steps.content: Power off your device. Use the power button or Accessibility menu to turn off your device. A factory reset will erase all your data from your phone. To reset without losing data , make sure to back up your device.

steps.title: Boot your phone in Recovery Mode.
steps.content: Boot your phone in Recovery Mode . With your device powered off, press and hold the device-specific button combination. The buttons will vary from device to device. [5] X Research source Most devices use Volume Up and Power. Some devices with physical user interfaces may use the Power and Home buttons. Samsung devices : Hold Volume Up, Home, and Power at the same time. [6] X Research source Google Pixel : Hold Volume Down and Power at the same time. When you see the Android logo, press and hold the Power key, and then press the Volume Up key once.

steps.title: Select a language.
steps.content: Select a language. Use the Volume buttons to scroll up and down, and use the Power button to confirm.

steps.title: Select Wipe data.
steps.content: Select Wipe data . Use the Volume buttons to scroll up and down, and use the Power button to confirm. [7] X Research source On some devices, this will look like Wipe data/factory reset . If you see this, select it. Then, select Yes to confirm your selection.

steps.title: Select Format data.
steps.content: Select Format data . This is the factory reset option.

steps.title: Enter the verification code.
steps.content: Enter the verification code. Use the keypad to enter the code on the screen.

steps.title: Tap Format.
steps.content: Tap Format . You'll see a confirmation prompt. The device will begin erasing the data.
